name: pants
text: A comment left by pants was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by CygnusX-1, divot, riotdejaneiro, Crowpaw, dismas, getawaykettle, luckypyjamas, HollyBones)

name: saint
text: I love Ray's logic. It's so mind-numbingly absurd, but he always has a reason or explanation. Achewood is magical.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: This is hilarious. Ray is a Peter Sellers character.

name: courtland
text:
Ray is spot on though, this has certainly happened to me. A lady and her family walks into the store where I work, and after talking for a spell I ask where she's from. "Well..." she hesitates, "just outside of London."
"Really? My father grew up near Esher (just south of London)."
She then realized I knew quite a bit more about England than she had anticipated, as her eyes lit up when I said Esher. After a quick chortle to herself, she says "Well, I'm from Esher."
We began discussing how lovely the area is and so forth and so on, her husband bought a load of stuff, and we all had a laugh. While it was a stroke of coincidence that we had connections to the same area of England, her initial hesitancy to say where she specifically lived was proven to be unneeded.
To be fair, Ray didn't ask Waterbury whether he was a Chelsea fan or loved EastEnders or anything though, did he?

name: sargasm
text: The cat gives his butler permission to be from London.

name: craigola
text: The cat's intuition is so good, he doesn't even know how good it is!

name: zefiel
text: A comment left by zefiel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by wildcat, redion, Bourbonsamurai, gorrioncita)

name: slalvation
text: I've eaten many a steak with only a knife in my lifetime. Sometimes there is not a clean fork, ok? And sometimes there is but I left it on the other side of the room. I'm not cleanin' and retrievin' forks when I'm tryin' to get my steak on.

name: soticoto
text: I eat my steaks with such as my teeth.

name: evolume
text: ...suddenly and unexpectedly, i am digging this story arc.

name: professoryes
text: I'm dreadfully curious how many people had to change their cities of residence just because "someone's heard of it before."

name: aelindil
text:
Just the indie kids.

"I liked your hometown better before it sold out."

name: stuntman
text: waterbury is totally above all that.

name: apocowarg
text: I live in the town of Waterbury, Vermont. This whole arc and its comments tickle me greatly.

name: love_is_so_punk
text: I've never heard of that town.

name: apocowarg
text: Neither has anyone who doesn't live within a fifteen mile radius of it. This town is so small our 4th of July parade is one state police car and an old guy in a 1972 Fiat eating saltines.

name: fattypneumonia
text: Oh, I thought you said "sardines."  My bad. Carry on.

name: shutup_shutup
text: This mostly happens with people from suburbs, because they are leeches.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Ray: Man, that backfired!
Roast Beef: Oh man huevos rancheros dinner
Philippe: Watching TV with Chris!
Lyle: man whatta shoot
Little Nephew: school eats tha wad

name: echidnaboy
text: OK, I know people always say "Oh man I will totally say that thing that he said if I ever get the chance," but I am promising here and now that if I ever direct a James Bond movie I will include the line "Possibly but improbably made by host. Odds very much against it. 007 out."

name: relaxing
text:
With this strip I've finished the assetbar archive. Total Strips Views: 1395
I love you all.
I love you all.

name: saulbellow
text: wir lieben dich auch

name: tekende
text: Pommes oder brot!

name: saulbellow
text: Aehmmmm, B- Brot?

name: matthew
text: That is SO DAMN TRUE! Everyone from England says they're from dang London. Except me, of course. I wouldn't say I was from London if I WAS from there.

name: echidnaboy
text: I dunno about that. I've never claimed to be a Londoner. A lot of Americans think all Brits are from London, because when you tell them where you live, they say, "Never heard of it. Is it near London?" and you say "Well, it's about 250 miles," and they say, "So it's near London."

name: hellofditties
text: I say London.  It's easier that way.

name: lechatbotte
text: Funny. When I'm on your side of the pond, they do the same thing. "So is that near Los Angeles or New York?" As if there wasn't anything between!

name: heccibiggs
text:
I'm from Greater London. At uni (particularly earlier on in the year), everyone always asks everyone where they're from, and I say either London or Greater London. This satisfies most people, but if I meet someone who is also from London, they'll ask whereabouts, I'll tell them, and they'll say "THAT'S NOT LONDON! YOU DON'T LIVE IN LONDON! I LIVE MORE IN LONDON THAN YOU DO! IT IS SO IMPORTANT THAT I BE MORE LONDON THAN EVERYONE ELSE!"

Okay that's not an exact quote but it's pretty much the gist.

name: zapatos
text: Living in Nevada I hear similar things.  You live in Nevada, is that near Las Vegas?

name: tekende
text: In the same way that a pregnant woman is near an unborn child.

name: zapatos
text: eight hours ~north?

name: tekende
text: Nope, try again.

name: zapatos
text: "not really"

name: littlefatdog
text: Ray once again shows evidence of genius level intuition beneath his blithe exterior

name: acefalco
text:
I may be wrong, but to me, the fact that he thanks Your Grace rather than Your Highness indicates he may work for the Vatican rather than the Queen.

I'm just saying.

name: rumblefish
text: Your Grace would mean he's reporting to a Duke, or Duchess...or possibly an Archbishop.

name: ravindra108
text: In a later strip he does say "Your Majesty", indicating the Queen.

name: milo
text: I'm from England and I've never claimed Londonage. mostly, as this comic says, cause it sounds cooler if I say I'm from Southampton. also I know a little about American geography so I'm the worst for asking if it's near this or that city, especially if it's in the north or west...

name: gunsofray
text: shit man, me too. and we're the same age. WEEEIIIIRRRRD.

name: harvestgold
text: I will now justify everything I say with "documents abound".
